verses.verse: My son <WH1121>, keep <WH8104> my words <WH561>, And lay up <WH6845> my commandments with thee <WH4687>.
Keep <WH8104> my commandments <WH4687> and live <WH2421>; And my law <WH8451> as the apple <WH380> of thine eye <WH5869>.
Bind <WH7194> them upon thy fingers <WH676>; Write <WH3789> them upon the tablet <WH3871> of thy heart <WH3820>.
Say <WH559> unto wisdom <WH2451>, Thou art my sister <WH269>; And call <WH7121> understanding <WH998> thy kinswoman <WH4129>:
That they may keep <WH8104> thee from the strange <WH2114> woman <WH802>, From the foreigner <WH5237> that flattereth <WH2505> with her words <WH561>.
For at the window <WH2474> of my house <WH1004> I looked <WH8259> forth through my lattice <WH822>;
And I beheld <WH7200> among the simple ones <WH6612>, I discerned <WH995> among the youths <WH1121>, A young man <WH5288> void <WH2638> of understanding <WH3820>,
Passing through <WH5674> the street <WH7784> near <WH681> her corner <WH6434>; And he went <WH6805> the way <WH1870> to her house <WH1004>,
In the twilight <WH5399>, in the evening <WH3117> of the day <WH380>, In the middle of the night <WH3915> and in the darkness <WH653>.
And <WH7125>, behold, there met him a woman <WH802> With the attire <WH7897> of a harlot <WH2181>, and wily <WH5341> of heart <WH3820>.
(She is clamorous <WH1993> and wilful <WH5637>; Her feet <WH7272> abide <WH7931> not in her house <WH1004>:
Now <WH6471> she is in the streets <WH7339>, now <WH6471> in the broad <WH7339> places <WH693>, And lieth in wait at <WH681> every corner <WH6438>.)
So she caught <WH2388> him <WH5401>, and kissed him <WH5810>, And with an impudent face <WH6440> she said unto him <WH559>:
Sacrifices <WH8002> of peace-offerings <WH2077> are with me <WH3117>; This day have I paid <WH7999> my vows <WH5088>.
Therefore came I forth <WH3318> to meet <WH7125> thee <WH7836>, Diligently to seek thy face <WH6440>, and I have found thee <WH4672>.
I have spread <WH7234> my couch <WH6210> with carpets <WH4765> of tapestry <WH2405>, With striped cloths of the yarn <WH330> of Egypt <WH4714>.
I have perfumed <WH5130> my bed <WH4904> With myrrh <WH4753>, aloes <WH174>, and cinnamon <WH7076>.
Come <WH3212>, let us take our fill <WH7301> of love <WH1730> until the morning <WH1242>; Let us solace <WH5965> ourselves with loves <WH159>.
For the man <WH376> is not at home <WH1004>; He is gone <WH1980> a long <WH7350> journey <WH1870>:
He hath taken <WH3947> a bag <WH6872> of money <WH3701> with him <WH3027>; He will come <WH935> home <WH1004> at the full <WH3117> moon <WH3677>.
With her much <WH7230> fair speech <WH3948> she causeth him to yield <WH5186>; With the flattering <WH2506> of her lips <WH8193> she forceth him along <WH5080>.
He goeth <WH1980> after <WH310> her straightway <WH6597>, As an ox <WH7794> goeth <WH935> to the slaughter <WH2874>, Or as one in fetters <WH5914> to the correction <WH4148> of the fool <WH191>;
Till an arrow <WH2671> strike <WH6398> through his liver <WH3516>; As a bird <WH6833> hasteth <WH4116> to the snare <WH6341>, And knoweth <WH3045> not that it is for his life <WH5315>.
Now therefore <WH1121>, my sons, hearken <WH8085> unto me <WH7181>, And attend to the words <WH561> of my mouth <WH6310>.
Let not thy heart <WH3820> decline <WH7847> to her ways <WH1870>; Go not astray <WH8582> in her paths <WH5410>.
For she hath cast down <WH5307> many <WH7227> wounded <WH2491>: Yea <WH2026>, all her slain are a mighty host <WH6099>.
Her house <WH1004> is the way <WH1870> to Sheol <WH7585>, Going down <WH3381> to the chambers <WH2315> of death <WH4194>.
